title: 111_hr1619
content: The Children's Health Protection Act of 2009 may be cited as such. Congress finds that millions of children and young adults are uninsured, with a significant portion suffering from chronic illnesses. Some states have increased the age of dependency for private insurance coverage to 25. Gaps in insurance coverage can lead to pre-existing condition exclusions. Eliminating pre-existing condition exclusions for children ensures access to healthcare. High-risk pools help those with pre-existing conditions but are often underfunded and unaffordable. Pre-existing condition limitations in the private market discourage families from leaving Medicaid or CHIP. Prohibition of pre-existing condition exclusions for children under group health plans. Amendments to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 and the Public Health Service Act prohibit pre-existing condition exclusions for individuals under 25 years of age in group health plans. Amendments to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 and the Public Health Service Act prohibit pre-existing condition exclusions for individuals under 25 years of age in group health plans. This includes removing paragraphs (2) and (4) and redesignating paragraph (3) as paragraph (2) in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendments made by this section apply to group health plans for plan years beginning after the 12th calendar month following the enactment of the Act, with a special rule for collective bargaining agreements. The amendments made by this section apply to group health plans for plan years beginning after the 12th calendar month following the enactment of the Act, with a special rule for collective bargaining agreements regarding the termination date. Prohibition of pre-existing condition exclusions for children in health insurance coverage in the individual market. Amendment to the Public Health Service Act prohibits pre-existing condition exclusions for individuals under 25 in the individual health insurance market. Effective immediately for all health insurance coverage offered. The Act applies to health insurance coverage in the individual market after 12 months from enactment.
